bibl.title: Military Orders detailing men to experimental sanitary camp at Columbia Barracks, November 10, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #81 recommends that eight privates be detailed for temporary duty at the experimental sanitary camp at Columbia Barracks and report to Reed. Included is a note written by Truby. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders detailing men to experimental sanitary camp at Columbia Barracks, November 10, 1900
div1.p:
Notice that these orders direct
that the men report to Maj. Reed
not to the Pres. of the Board. Also
that they are ordered to the Camp
for duty

Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
DEC 3 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. NOV 22 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 247 A

HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF WESTERN CUBA,
Quemados, November 10, 1900.

1. Leave of absence for ten (10) days, on surgeon's
certificate of disability, is hereby granted Colonel W. L.
Haskin, 2d Artillery.

2. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Surgeon, the
following named privates of the Hospital Corps, U. S.
Army, are hereby detailed for temporary duty at an
experimental sanitary camp at Columbia Barracks, and will
report to Major Walter Reed, Surgeon, U. S. Army;
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
